titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Chester W. Barker sheet music collection M2134

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-06-29 09:18:42 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Chester W. Barker sheet music collection
did.abstract: Sheet music collected by Stanford alumnus Chester Barker.
did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36 hours in advance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chester Wing Barker earned his A.B. in English at Stanford University in May 1918. He was married to E. Catherine Crabtree, also of the Stanford class of 1918, and was later a realtor in Los Angeles. Based on their music store stamps, Barker purchased this music in and around Palo Alto for the most part, and many were probably used in local theatrical productions. This collection contains approximately 70 items dating from 1891-1973, the majority of which are from musicals. Condition varies but is generally poor. Almost all are inscribed by Barker with notes, pasted-in lyrics, and a few programs. Three items are inscribed by the composer: Thurlow Lieurance signed one to Mrs. Edward Robinson and Emmet Pendleton signed two for Barker himself. A listing created by the donor is available. Stanford Libraries hold two other collections from Barker: Chester W. Barker scrapbook, 1915-1933 (http://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/5793114) and San Jose, CA : album of theater clippings, ca. 1910 (http://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/5479465).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to Stanford University, Special Collections in 2008.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Chester W. Barker Sheet Music Collection (M2134). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged more or less by the name of the first composer or lyricist credited on cover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes several volumes in the "Musik fur alle" series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Down the Hatch" by Mac Gordon & Frank O'Neill, with 1937 program inserted ; "Four Hits From The Ram's Head Big Game Gaieties" with humorous songs by Bob Mallet, Mac Gordon & Frank O'Neill.
